item.title: Creating a logo in Inkscape - process
item.description:
This weekend I spent some computer time not writing or reading code, but actually toying around with Inkscape to create a logo. While it created using very simple operations in Inkscape, it took me quite a while to remember the shortcuts and how to merge objects.

This logo is not actually used. It was an entry to a call for proposals.

The Process

This post won’t have much text. It will be more screen shots of the process with short commentaire.

item.title: Drawing Santos Dumont's "Encantada" in Krita
item.description:
With Krita 4.x released, and the Krita monthly challenge of May still open for submission, I decided to give it a go and try this new version to create an artwork to for the challenge. The topic of this month’s challenge is Home.

My submission was Santos Dumont’s house in Petropolis, Rio de Janeiro, called Encantada.

item.title: My favourite Star Trek captain: Jean-Luc Picard
item.description: My favourite Star Trek captain: Jean-Luc Picard. “Space, the final frontier. These are the voyages of the starship Enterprise. Its continuing mission: to explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no one has gone before!” Jean-Luc Picard Jean-Luc Picard 2B pencil, rubber eraser, blending stump, and HB 0.3 mechanical pencil. Yellow-ish layer added adjusting LAB colour space in GIMP.

item.description: Archer, from redditgetsdrawn. Archer drawing Archer photo Simplified and changed her angle. On DeviantArt too.

item.title: Drawing sketch: Page 036
item.description: Page 036 Almost ANZAC day. And almost time to switch back to coding Jenkins plug-ins. Normally sketch more in-between development cycles for Open Source projects, or contract works. Krill: Krill are small crustaceans of the order Euphausiacea, and are found in all the world’s oceans. The name krill comes from the Norwegian word krill, meaning “small fry of fish”, which is also often attributed to species of fish. Tui: Tui are boisterous, medium-sized, common and widespread bird of forest and suburbia – unless you live in Canterbury.

item.title: Proposed logos for OpenNLP
item.description: A couple of logos submitted to OPENNLP-6. Made with Inkscape, fonts from Google Fonts.

item.title: Drawing Terra Celta vocal Elcio
item.description: Terra Celta band’s vocal, Elcio. Brazil is not only Samba, there is (good) celtic music in there too :-) Terra Celta ("Celtic Land") is a Brazilian Celtic comedy rock band formed in 2005, and based in Londrina, Paraná. They are noted for making Celtic rock in Portuguese language (initially English), with often humorous lyrics. The group performs live with traditional Celtic/Irish clothing. Besides performing Irish music, the members also research the subject, by attending Celtic music festivals in Europe.

item.title: Drawing sketch: Uh!
item.description: Sketch. And final work here. For redditgetsdrawn

item.title: Revamping Frege logo - part 2
item.description: Last time I used Blender was around 2007 I think, in University. But the bad weather in Auckland gives me plenty of time to have fun checking out Blender again :-) Followed the following tutorials: How to create a 3D Logo in Blender Blender Tutorial Spinning Logo Here are the work in progress, created only with the bézier curve. Frege updated logo Frege 3D #1 Frege 3D #2 Frege 3D #3 Frege 3D #4 Frege 3D #5 Frege 3D #6 Frege 3D #7 Here’s the result after the mesh was created, and some material applied.

item.title: Revamping Frege logo
item.description: For a while I had been wanting to try adding a flat colour to the Frege logo. This weekend had some bit of spare time, and here is the result. Submitted to the project as pull request #299. Current logo. Frege current logo And the updated logo. Frege updated logo The colour used was Flamingo (#EF4836), found in Flat UI Color Picker. Perhaps not exactly revamping, since all I did was just change a colour.
